title: if-let chain on nightly: rustc panicked at expected `NodeId` to be lowered

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I am new to rust, and I found this bug while trying to guess whether I could chain if-let expressions with &&. I created a smaller example that causes the panic. This appears to only panic on nightly. For the record, I was slightly drunk when I found this bug. :) ### Code ```Rust fn main() { let a = Some(1); let b = Some(2); if let Some(x) = a && let Some(y) = b { let z = x; } } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` --------@-----MacBook-Pro crash % rustc +nightly --version --verbose rustc 1.52.0-nightly (9b471a3f5 2021-02-19) binary: rustc commit-hash: 9b471a3f5fe57e5c6e08acf665f2094422415a3d commit-date: 2021-02-19 host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.52.0-nightly LLVM version: 11.0.1 ``` ### Error output ``` --------@-----MacBook-Pro src % cargo +nightly build Compiling crash v0.1.0 (/Users/-----/src/local/crash) error[E0658]: `let` expressions in this position are experimental --> src/main.rs:6:9 | 6 | let Some(x) = a && | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: see issue #53667 for more information = help: add `#![feature(let_chains)]` to the crate attributes to enable error[E0658]: `let` expressions in this position are experimental --> src/main.rs:7:9 | 7 | let Some(y) = b | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: see issue #53667 for more information = help: add `#![feature(let_chains)]` to the crate attributes to enable thread 'rustc' panicked at 'expected `NodeId` to be lowered already for res Local( NodeId(26), )', compiler/rustc_ast_lowering/src/lib.rs:713:17 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.52.0-nightly (9b471a3f5 2021-02-19) running on x86_64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack error: aborting due to 2 previous errors For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0658`. error: could not compile `crash` To learn more, run the command again with --verbose. ```
Backtrace

``` --------@-----MacBook-Pro crash % RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo +nightly build Compiling crash v0.1.0 (/Users/------/src/local/crash) error[E0658]: `let` expressions in this position are experimental --> src/main.rs:6:9 | 6 | let Some(x) = a && | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: see issue #53667 for more information = help: add `#![feature(let_chains)]` to the crate attributes to enable error[E0658]: `let` expressions in this position are experimental --> src/main.rs:7:9 | 7 | let Some(y) = b | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: see issue #53667 for more information = help: add `#![feature(let_chains)]` to the crate attributes to enable thread 'rustc' panicked at 'expected `NodeId` to be lowered already for res Local( NodeId(26), )', compiler/rustc_ast_lowering/src/lib.rs:713:17 stack backtrace: 0: _rust_begin_unwind 1: std::panicking::begin_panic_fmt 2: rustc_ast_lowering::LoweringContext::lower_res::{{closure}}::{{closure}} 3: rustc_ast_lowering::LoweringContext::lower_node_id_generic 4: rustc_ast_lowering::path::::lower_qpath 5: rustc_ast_lowering::expr::::lower_expr_mut::{{closure}} 6: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack 7: rustc_ast_lowering::LoweringContext::lower_stmt 8: core::ops::function::impls:: for &mut F>::call_mut 9: as core::iter::traits::iterator::Iterator>::next 10: as core::iter::traits::collect::Extend<::Item>>::extend 11: rustc_arena::cold_path 12: rustc_ast_lowering::expr::::lower_expr_if 13: rustc_ast_lowering::expr::::lower_expr_mut::{{closure}} 14: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack 15: core::ops::function::impls:: for &mut F>::call_mut 16: as core::iter::traits::iterator::Iterator>::next 17: as core::iter::traits::collect::Extend<::Item>>::extend 18: rustc_arena::cold_path 19: rustc_ast_lowering::item::::lower_block_expr_opt 20: rustc_ast_lowering::item::::lower_fn_body_block 21: rustc_ast_lowering::item::::lower_item 22: rustc_ast_lowering::LoweringContext::with_hir_id_owner 23: rustc_ast_lowering::lower_crate 24: rustc_interface::passes::BoxedResolver::access::{{closure}} 25: rustc_interface::passes::configure_and_expand::{{closure}} 26: rustc_interface::queries::Queries::lower_to_hir 27: rustc_interface::queries::Queries::global_ctxt 28: rustc_interface::queries::::enter 29: rustc_span::with_source_map 30: scoped_tls::ScopedKey::set note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.52.0-nightly (9b471a3f5 2021-02-19) running on x86_64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack error: aborting due to 2 previous errors For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0658`. error: could not compile `crash` To learn more, run the command again with --verbose. ```
